verses.verse: "How<WH4100> beautiful<WH3302> are your feet<WH6471> in sandals,<WH5275> O prince's daughter!<WH1323> The curves<WH2542> of your hips<WH3409> are like<WH3644> jewels,<WH2481> The work<WH4639> of the hands<WH3027> of an artist.<WH542>

"Your navel<WH8270> is [like] a round<WH5469> goblet<WH101> Which never<WH408> lacks<WH2637> mixed<WH4197> wine;<WH4197> Your belly<WH990> is like a heap<WH6194> of wheat<WH2406> Fenced<WH5473> about<WH5473> with lilies.<WH7799>
"Your two<WH8147> breasts<WH7699> are like two<WH8147> fawns,<WH6082> Twins<WH9639> of a gazelle.<WH6646>

"Your neck<WH6677> is like a tower<WH4026> of ivory,<WH8127> Your eyes<WH5869> [like] the pools<WH1295> in Heshbon<WH2809> By the gate<WH8179> of Bath-rabbim; Your nose<WH639> is like the tower<WH4026> of Lebanon,<WH3844> Which faces<WH6440> toward<WH6440> Damascus.<WH1834>

"Your head<WH7218> crowns<WH5921> you like Carmel,<WH3760> And the flowing<WH9089> locks<WH9089> of your head<WH7218> are like purple<WH713> threads;<WH713> [The] king<WH4428> is captivated<WH631> by [your] tresses.<WH9547>
"How<WH4100> beautiful<WH3302> and how<WH4100> delightful<WH5276> you are, [My] love,<WH160> with [all] your charms!<WH8588>
"Your stature<WH6967> is like<WH1819> a palm<WH8558> tree,<WH8558> And your breasts<WH7699> are [like its] clusters.<WH811>

"I said,<WH559> 'I will climb<WH5927> the palm<WH8558> tree,<WH8558> I will take<WH270> hold<WH270> of its fruit<WH5577> stalks.<WH5577>' Oh,<WH4994> may<WH4994> your breasts<WH7699> be like clusters<WH811> of the vine,<WH1612> And the fragrance<WH7381> of your breath<WH639> like apples,<WH8598>

And your mouth<WH2441> like the best<WH2896> wine!<WH3196>" "It goes<WH1980> [down] smoothly<WH4339> for my beloved,<WH1730> Flowing<WH1680> gently<WH1680> [through] the lips<WH8193> of those who<WH3463> fall<WH3463> asleep.<WH3463>
"I am my beloved's, And his desire<WH8669> is for me.
"Come,<WH1980> my beloved,<WH1730> let us go<WH3318> out into the country,<WH7704> Let us spend<WH3885> the night<WH3885> in the villages.<WH3723>

"Let us rise<WH7925> early<WH7925> [and go] to the vineyards;<WH3754> Let us see<WH7200> whether<WH518> the vine<WH1612> has budded<WH6524> [And its] blossoms<WH5563> have opened,<WH6605> [And whether] the pomegranates<WH7416> have bloomed.<WH9343> There<WH8033> I will give<WH5414> you my love.<WH1730>

"The mandrakes<WH1736> have given<WH5414> forth fragrance;<WH7381> And over<WH5921> our doors<WH6607> are all<WH3605> choice<WH4022> [fruits,] Both new<WH2319> and old,<WH3465> Which I have saved<WH6845> up for you, my beloved.<WH1730>
